comment.author: 7225349@N03
comment._content: A classic from the history books of my school time, it must have been cropped by Gill & Macmillan or whoever published our history books as I don't recall the wet cobbles and puddles in the foreground!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: Have become quite conscious of wet paths, etc. in the photos. Think it's quite remarkable, given our climate, that so few look wet/muddy
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 32149975@N07
comment._content: Great photo. What year was this taken? (Actually that would be nice additional information for all the photos in this collection).

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: Hi Sarah! I've been adding dates (exact or approximate) to all photos in the above the map slot, e.g. for this one: "This photo was taken some time in 1914..." D'you think it'd be better to include it in the Description area??
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 32149975@N07
comment._content: Oh yes I see it now, sorry. Maybe it would be easier to see in the description (if it's no trouble!)

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/sarahkmc] No trouble at all!  :)  Adding dates to things gives me great nerdy pleasure...

comment._content: As mentioned, this has been re-printed over and over. Critical moment in our history.
